definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
dialect/language/speech
to tell to
where/how
(negative prefix)/not/no
detailed/comprehensive

sentences.english: As usual it gives few details of China’s own weapons.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，該文件對中國所持有的武器語焉不詳。

sentences.english: Zines today are even more elaborate.
sentences.chinese: 雜誌今天更是語焉不詳。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to prevail upon/to coax
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
shameful secret
exclusive property/forbidden domain
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
